Henry Story wrote:
> On 23 Mar 2007, at 11:49, Bill de hOra wrote:
>> Henry Story wrote:
>> > You don't get it in simple RDF/XML, because they are building things
>> > layer by layer.
>>
>> That's like saying you don't get macros in sexprs because they built
>> Lisp at another layer. N3 is not RDF. Saying that's easy in N3 is
>> irrelevant to RDF Henry; you know this.
> No, the Semantic Seb stack is work in progress. 

"N3 is not RDF." - I find this to be indisputable. Talking about stacks 
and works in progress isn't technically relevant.

> The Turtle subset of N3 (ie without graphs and rules) is just another 
> serialization of RDF.

If so, then the turtle subset of N3 isn't N3, it's RDF. You're making my 
point.

> Are you going to stay that RDF is incompatible with rules, because that 
> working group has not yet finished its work?

Rules, what are they? I'm saying that RDF and N3 are different logical 
languages (I'm not even sure N3 is defined independently of the cwm 
code). If you want to say what N3 lets you say, I'd tend "just use" Prolog.

cheers
Bill
